definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: The meat needs soft fire now.
Will slow fire on the medicinal steam, and then to suppress drug Draw Frame into tortillas .
sentences.chinese: 将上药用文火蒸熟，然后将药调匀压制成小饼。

sentences.english: Add the mustard and milk and bring to a simmer.
sentences.chinese: 加入芥末和牛奶然后用文火慢慢煮。

sentences.english: Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together.
sentences.chinese: 将大黄和甘菊一起煮沸再用文火炖，熬成汤药。

sentences.english: But for the practical purposes of this book, weshall seldom consider it necessary.
sentences.chinese: 不过为求实际，这本书中对文火慢炖不做要求。

sentences.english: Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together…
sentences.chinese: 将大黄和甘菊一起煮沸再用文火炖，熬成汤药。

sentences.english: Simmer gently for 20 m then drain the solution.
sentences.chinese: 文火煎20分钟，然后将药水滗出。

sentences.english: When it start to boil, turn down the heat and let the sauce simmer.
sentences.chinese: 逐渐沸腾时，关小炉火，以文火慢慢煨调味酱。

sentences.english: Putting a meal in the slow cooker saves you from needing to heat up the kitchen later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 用文火慢慢炖着，可以省去在黄昏时分到厨房里加热。

sentences.english: Turn the heat down so the sauce simmers gently.
sentences.chinese: 将炉火调小，用文火炖调味汁。

sentences.english: A soft fire make sweet malt.

definition: to cook in a covered vessel/to casserole/to stew
variant of 砂鍋|砂锅[sha1 guo1]
to cook slowly over a low flame/pot/saucepan
